commit_message:
Update policy.d spec to reflect what actually happened

These changes are not about 'intent', but rather how the intent
translated into practice.  There were two charms that didn't need
overrides, and this created space for an additional charm to be included
in the 19.10 release cycle.  Also, more in-depth testing was possible,
and the spec is updated to reflect that.

Change-Id: Idcd59828ce81581f8e088948a3d55b38b06cbdf7

commit_message:
Add appendix on Policy Overrides

Add a general appendix about how policy overrides work.

Change-Id: Ic2b1f85cc7ad41d6fe69d379736d5dec614ef176
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-deployment-guide refs/changes/33/682033/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Appendix N: Policy Overrides ============================ Overview ++++++++ This appendix is intended to provide an overview of how an operator can provide policy overrides for various services. It provides a description of the general mechanism. However, individual charm READMEs should be consulted to see if they provide the policy override feature and what options may be available on it. Background ++++++++++ The Policy Overrides feature provides a mechanism for operators to modify the policies within OpenStack services in order to manage the permissions of the tenants and users of the system. It is NOT intended that this facility is used to manage the permissions of the services themselves, and steps are taken to prevent this where possible. The charms will continue to manage the policies of the service users directly (e.g. keystone, glance, nova) using the default policy files within the charms themselves. The preferred approach has always been to use charm options to enable a more controlled approach to modifying the policy of a service by providing templates that the options modify - i.e. a controlled approach that always results in consistent policy files. However, over time, it has become apparent that there will always be an aspect of the policy of a service that an operator wants to tweak or change that the charm authors hadn't considered, and the cycle time to introduce the option exceeds the expectations of the delay that an operator is willing to tolerate. Therefore, it has been recognised that there are aspects of the configuration files that the charms control need to be more fluidly modifiable by operators. These tend to be orthogonal to the act of deployment and instead are to do with operating the cloud. So, the objective is to provide to operators with a mechanism to override the policy defaults without (hopefully) breaking the system functioning. The policy defaults are either coded in the service via "policy-in-code" and/or via a default policy YAML file provided by the charm/service. Facility Offered ++++++++++++++++ The general facility offered is the ability to: - Create YAML files that contain any rules that are allowed in policy files for each service. - The YAML files are zipped into a zip file. - The zip file will be attached/uploaded to the charm using Juju resources. - A config item named ``use-policyd-override`` is set to ``True``. This will cause the charm to unzip the attached file, do some validation checks, and then drop the file(s) in the the ``/etc/<service-name>/policy.d/`` directory. The OpenStack service will then use these overrides to add to, change, or remove the default charm- or package-determined policies and thus provide the permissions that the operator requires. Some charms may wish to provide a template system with the policy overrides. In this case the override file may include template variables that the charm will substitute with data that the charm has from config, the enviroment, or through relation data. This will be documented within the charms' README file. Policies across the OpenStack services ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ The policy override system described here is *per charm*. Thus if several services require policy overrides then a policy override resource zip file needs to be created for each charm and applied to the service. Juju commands +++++++++++++ The zipped file of policy override files is attached to the charm by: juju attach-resource <charm-name> policyd-override=<some-file> The ``<charm-name>`` is the name that this charm is deployed as, with ``<some-file>`` being the resource file containing the policy overrides. The policy override is enabled in the charm using: juju config <charm-name> use-policyd-override=true Again, ``<charm-name>`` is the service charm that the overrides should be switched on for. Juju workload status ++++++++++++++++++++ The Juju workload status is modified for a charm which has policy overrides enabled. For a successful policy override (from the charms' perspective), then workload status is prefixed with ``PO:``. This shows that the policies have been overrided for that service. If policies have been overridden, but there is a problem with the resource file, then the prefix will be ``PO: (broken)``. This means that the policies **are not** overridden, but that the option ``use-policyd-overrides`` is set. e.g. operator intervention is required to either disable the policy overrides, or to fix the policy override files and re-attach them to the charm. The charms' debug-log will show any issues that the policy override feature found in the attached resource. This should show where the issue is. Possible issues with policy overrides +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ This is charm dependent, so the individual charm README files should be consulted. However, the following general issues may arise: - The zip file is not properly formatted. Check that the pkunzip command can open and test the enclosed files. - There are no files in the zip file that have an extension of ``.yaml``, or ``.yml``. - There are duplicate named files in the zip file. Zip files are "flattened" and lower-cased. Any duplicates will cause a failure. - An identified Yaml file in the zip file is not formatted correctly; as it can't be loaded, it won't be written to the policy.d override folder. - The template substitution function errors. - A blacklisted key has been used in the policy override. Individual charms may choose to disallow the override of particular rules in the policy file. In this case the policy file will be rejected. If this occurs, then the status line will show ``PO (broken):`` and the debug log for the charm should be consulted. .. note:: The hook (install, upgrade, config-changed) will not fail if the policy override is broken. The policy overrides will not be installed, and the status line will indicate a failure. It is not a charm breakage if the policy overrides are not installed as the overrides should be orthogonal to the operation of the charm. i.e. they are to do with tenants and user permissions, and not the operation of the underlying services. .. note:: The individual charms' README files must be consulted to discover the services offered by the charm with respect to policy overrides.

Add CORS config support

commit_message:
Policyd override implementation

This patchset implements policy overrides for nova-cloud-controler.

This change includes a charm-helpers sync to bring in the policyd helper
code.

Note there are no functional tests for this feature as the charm still
uses the old style non-zaza amulet framework.  The Related-Bug below is
tracking this issue.

Change-Id: Ia5f3f8189d4a7b7b46a827707d964ebe40740aeb
Closes-Bug: #1741723
Related-Bug: #1845639
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-nova-cloud-controller refs/changes/26/685726/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Spec: V1 API rating modules endpoints migration to V2 API

See migrate_v1_rating_modules_api_endpoints_to_v2.rst for details.

Change-Id: Ic52d0162b478ebcd353e2e3fbf224937222d816e
Story: 2006572
Task: 36679
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty-specs refs/changes/92/682892/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =================================================== V1 API rating modules endpoints migration to V2 API =================================================== https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2006572 With the v1 api being frozen, migrating endpoints that are not present in the v2 api is nessecary to achieve a complete v2 API with both existing v1 features and new v2 ones. This spec is about the `/v1/rating/modules` endpoints. Problem Description =================== The v2 api does not feature endpoints present in the v1 api. The v2 api uses Flask, while the v1 api uses WSME + pecan. The code and api features are thus split between different frameworks and endpoints. This is not ideal for contributors and api users. Proposed Change =============== Implementing the existings `/v1/rating/modules` into the v2 api. This is part of the broader effort to migrate v1 endpoints to the v2 api. Alternatives ------------ None. Data model impact ----------------- None. REST API impact --------------- While the endpoints will be migrated and use Flask, no further modifications to methods are needed. All methods will keep existing v1 functionality and behaviors. Security impact --------------- None. Notifications Impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- Support of migrated v2 endpoints have to be implemented in cloudkitty's client as described in the worflow. Performance Impact ------------------ None other than potential WSME + pecan -> flask performance difference. Other deployer impact --------------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- API understanding, use and contribution should be more straightforward and easy. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: qanglade/qanglade Other contributors: lukapeschke/peschk_l Work Items ---------- * Implement the `/v1/rating/modules` endpoints in the v2 API * Add unit tests to new endpoint * Update the documentation to reflect changes Dependencies ============ * Flask * Flask-RESTful * os-api-ref (for API reference generation) Testing ======= Unit tests will be added to cover the new v2 endpoint. Documentation Impact ==================== None. References ========== None.

commit_message:
Fix unit tests with ironicclient >=3.0.0

We need to mock all invocations of the ironic client,
otherwise we see failures with python-ironicclient 3.0.0.

Change-Id: I9279d79f039177e150a59aefa5c660c568dd18b6
(cherry picked from commit 66faa425b97c8be9ea1cfb0ac65f4e5ff3476997)

commit_message:
Implement generation of shared secret for metadata

The ``nova-compute`` charm gates enablement of the local Nova
metadata service on presence of the ``metadata-shared-secret``
key in the relation data in the subordinate relation with
``neutron-plugin`` interface.  This is implemented in the classic
``neutron-openvswitch`` charm today.

Add the bits necessary for a reactive charm to participate in this
part of the relation.

Also adds units tests to the interface.

Change-Id: I358e60c40a7f7c0cd33b31f2b7a8c58d6cb83326

commit_message:
check-review-status: update age calc

This patch changes the approval script to allow approving the change
after 7 days. This should also clarify all the "earliest" dates by
making sure they have a time in UTC.

Co-Authored-By: Nate Johnston <nate.johnston@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>
Change-Id: I611dd4e44928c42dae35fd9527a62fa948a2cc3f

commit_message:
Squash database patches

Remove patches up to the Newton release to speed up
initial deployment and tests, as we don't support
previous versions anymore.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/686996

commit_message:
Fix tempest source install condition

Because of jinja2 templating delimiters inside when statement tempest
wasn't correctly installed from source.
Also condition is simplified to be more readable. install_method check
works as we would like to run venv installation only for source
installs, but not for the ubuntu mixed setup.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/686041
Change-Id: I39332a35fb2edae65a4762fe24c5b1f8c8675a2b

subject: resolve confusing state when rebuilding
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-19 08:22:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/872ad7277183cf210352f024f5a739ff540cd67f', 'message': 'resolve confusing state when rebuilding

When nova-compute starts, all instances in rebuilding
state will be set to error and task_state[None].
if then nova-compute receives rpc to rebuild instance,
will raise UnexpectedTaskStateError. So confusing state
occurs:
REBUILD(rebuilding) -> ERROR(None) -> REBUILD(rebuilding)
Finally, instance will keep REBUILD even though rebuilding
terminated.
I change the exception handling for UnexpectedTaskStateError,
if decide to resume rebuild, state changing likes:
REBUILD(rebuilding) -> ERROR(None) ->
REBUILD(rebuild_spawning) -> ACTIVE(None)
else:
REBUILD(rebuilding) -> ERROR(None)

Closes-Bug: #1741817

commit_message:
resolve confusing state when rebuilding

When nova-compute starts, all instances in rebuilding state will be set to error
and task_state[None].
If then nova-compute receives rpc to rebuild instance, will raise
UnexpectedTaskStateError. So confusing state occurs:
REBUILD(rebuilding) -> ERROR(None) -> REBUILD(rebuilding)
Finally, instance will keep REBUILD even though rebuilding terminated.
I change the exception handling for UnexpectedTaskStateError,
if decide to resume rebuild, state changing likes:
REBUILD(rebuilding) -> ERROR(None) -> REBUILD(rebuild_spawning) -> ACTIVE(None)
else:
REBUILD(rebuilding) -> ERROR(None)

Closes-Bug: #1741817
Change-Id: I8ecfe610568f7654503bd48f01f0477525a20b23

commit_message:
Disable ip_version checking while updating member without new ip

If member gets updated with new data, but without IP version
we shouldn't be checking if ip_version differs from the listener.

Related-Bug: #1843553

Change-Id: I5edfc70efeaa0758373ecfb2fa12f4721c6fb1f8

commit_message:
Error out interrupted builds

If the compute service is restarted while build requests are
executing the instance_claim or waiting for the COMPUTE_RESOURCE_SEMAPHORE
then those instances will be stuck forever in BUILDING state. If the instance
already finished instance_claim then instance.host is set and when the
compute restarts the instance is put to ERROR state.

This patch changes compute service startup to put instances into
ERROR state if they a) are in the BUILDING state, and b) have
allocations on the compute resource provider, but c) do not have
instance.host set to that compute.

Change-Id: I856a3032c83fc2f605d8c9b6e5aa3bcfa415f96a
Closes-Bug: #1833581
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/57/666857/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: evacuated_instances = self._destroy_evacuated_instances( context) or {} if instance.uuid not in evacuated_instances: already_handled = {instance.uuid for instance in instances}.union( evacuated_instances.keys()) self._error_out_instances_whose_build_was_interrupted( context, already_handled) def _error_out_instances_whose_build_was_interrupted( self, context, already_handled_instances): """If there are instances in BUILD state that are not assigned to this host but has allocation in placement towards this compute that means the nova-compute service was restarted while those instances waited for the resource claim to finish and the _set_instance_host_and_node() to update the instance.host field. We need to push them to ERROR state here to prevent keeping them in BUILD state forever. :param context: The request context :param already_handled_instances: The set of instance uuid that the host initialization process already handled in some way. """ # Strategy: # 1) Get the allocations from placement for our compute node(s) # 2) Remove the already handled instances from the consumer list # they are either already initialized or needs to be skipped. # 3) Check which remaining consumer is an instance in BUILD state # and push it to ERROR state. node_names = self.driver.get_available_nodes() for node_name in node_names: try: cn_uuid = objects.ComputeNode.get_by_host_and_nodename( context, self.host, node_name).uuid except exception.ComputeHostNotFound: LOG.info( "Compute node %s not found in the database", node_name) continue try: f = self.reportclient.get_allocations_for_resource_provider allocations = f(context, cn_uuid).allocations except (exception.ResourceProviderAllocationRetrievalFailed, keystone_exception.ClientException) as e: LOG.info("Compute node resource provider not found %s", e) continue consumers = set(allocations.keys()) not_handled_consumers = consumers - already_handled_instances for consumer in not_handled_consumers: try: instance = objects.Instance.get_by_uuid(context, consumer) if instance.vm_state == vm_states.BUILDING: LOG.debug("Instance failed to spawn correctly, " "setting to ERROR state", instance=instance) instance.task_state = None instance.vm_state = vm_states.ERROR instance.save() except exception.InstanceNotFound: LOG.debug( "Consumer %s is not an instance, skipping", consumer) continue
deleted_lines: evacuated_instances = self._destroy_evacuated_instances(context) if (not evacuated_instances or instance.uuid not in evacuated_instances):

added_lines: def _test_update_chassis_metadata_networks_helper( self, dp, remove, expected_dps, txn_called=True): current_dps = ['0', '1', '2'] with mock.patch.object(self.agent.sb_idl, 'get_chassis_metadata_networks', return_value=current_dps),\ mock.patch.object(self.agent.sb_idl, 'set_chassis_metadata_networks', retrurn_value=True),\ mock.patch.object(self.agent.sb_idl, 'create_transaction') as create_txn_mock: self.agent.update_chassis_metadata_networks(dp, remove=remove) updated_dps = self.agent.sb_idl.get_chassis_metadata_networks( self.agent.chassis) self.assertEqual(updated_dps, expected_dps) self.assertEqual(create_txn_mock.called, txn_called) def test_update_chassis_metadata_networks_add(self): dp = '4' remove = False expected_dps = ['0', '1', '2', '4'] self._test_update_chassis_metadata_networks_helper( dp, remove, expected_dps) def test_update_chassis_metadata_networks_remove(self): dp = '2' remove = True expected_dps = ['0', '1'] self._test_update_chassis_metadata_networks_helper( dp, remove, expected_dps) def test_update_chassis_metadata_networks_add_dp_exists(self): dp = '2' remove = False expected_dps = ['0', '1', '2'] self._test_update_chassis_metadata_networks_helper( dp, remove, expected_dps, txn_called=False) def test_update_chassis_metadata_networks_remove_no_dp(self): dp = '3' remove = True expected_dps = ['0', '1', '2'] self._test_update_chassis_metadata_networks_helper( dp, remove, expected_dps, txn_called=False)

subject: Add stable/train to periodic-stable templates

Add the stable/train branch to the list of branch for the
periodic stable job templates.

Change-Id: Ibb24d767a37021db2bc462511a2ee59dd8889930

commit_message:
Add stable/train to periodic-stable templates

Add the stable/train branch to the list of branch for the
periodic stable job templates.

Change-Id: Ibb24d767a37021db2bc462511a2ee59dd8889930
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs refs/changes/22/687122/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - stable/train - stable/train - stable/train - stable/train - stable/train - stable/train

commit_message:
Introduce molecule tests in the tripleo-upgrade role

This patch adds the first structure to
run molecule and test this role

It includes a basic escenario to run the tripleo-upgrade
role without parameters.

Change-Id: I3fdb22b5496bb0c16cc4201f542366e97fc0e1fc

'}]
commit_message:
get swift health-check info when we run tempest.

I tested the following api test (tempest.api.object_storage.test_healthcheck.HealthcheckTest).
Before the test, I installed and configured ceph-radosgateway in order to use RGW-Swift.

I edited the 2 files. and then I can successfully get the health status.

Change-Id: I0838332ffa71c2fec9dc8a0fde83f8c7c83c6055

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Note that release note for train doesn't seem to be ready.
(no 4_0_0_0_hash file exists)

Change-Id: Ia1f9e21af0eab90e1685e9e482fd8affcc415989
Sem-Ver: feature

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-12 17:19:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/3906093dc5b61a9aa378823b6e2962bb931ab6a0', 'message': 'Allow VMs to use unaddressed port

but security groups are only allowed on neutron ports that
have their port security enabled.
So nova can allow a VM to boot with a specified port if

Change-Id: Ic622f9a98766bf583b8fd478bd2637cc562b3f80

commit_message:
Allow VMs to use unaddressed ports

Users can create a port with ip_allocation=none, which means
that the port will never have an IP. The result is a port
with fixed_ips=[].
Nova needs a fixed ip to be set to apply security groups,
but security groups are only allowed on a neutron port if its
port_security attribute is set to True.
Hence, nova can allow a VM to boot with an unaddressed port specified if
that port has its port_security set to False.

Change-Id: Ic622f9a98766bf583b8fd478bd2637cc562b3f80
Implements: blueprint vm-boot-with-unaddressed-port
Closes-Bug: #1741575

subject: auto-sharding: send shard-ranges via container UPDATE
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-07-25 07:33:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/f59ed488dcff01c2c336f69f39a866932744ae37', 'message': 'auto-sharding: send shard-ranges via container UPDATE

This is more of a POC. The idea is pretty straight forward.

Before this patch:
 - a leader is determined to be the scanner node
 - that node will then go scan for shard ranges.
 - Once found, the scanner/leader asks via an all quorum if they're
   still the leader.
 - If they are, then write the shard ranges into my DB and let
   replication spread them out.

This sounds great. But there is an edge case, what happens if the
replication fails? We can't roll back the shard ranges by removing
them locally because the container replicators in the meal while might
have already managed to push somewhere because of a network blip.

For example, what happens if replication is down for that node after writing
the ranges, or the server goes down for maintenence, and a rebalance
happens, and now this "leader" who has shard ranges is a handoff. But
will still offload it's ranges when back online. Even after another leader
has since been elected and replicated a different set of ranges.

This patch is trying solve that edge case by  reducing that potentail gap
between the finding and inserting shard ranges locally and it's eventual
replication.
It does it by taking advantage of the "still leader" quorum. If it still
is the leader after finding shard ranges, it goes and updates the other
primaries using the new container UPDATE verb. So long as one of those
is successful, it's safe to write the shard ranges locally.
If all UPDATEs fail, the scanner safely throws away the ranges and will
have another go when the connection or whatever is back.

It in essence gives us a rollback without having to be smart with
replication locking (locking out the container-replicators) writing and
checking if we managed to replication in the sharder.

This is just a POC to test out the theory, just a possible solution.

The real question is, is the edgecase real? Or can we somehow just be
smarter in replication.

Change-Id: I39f07180ce7990702e4fdfe7e43f313781d7e7d3

commit_message:
auto-sharding: send shard-ranges via container UPDATE

This is more of a POC. The idea is pretty straight forward.

Before this patch:
 - a leader is determined to be the scanner node
 - that node will then go scan for shard ranges.
 - Once found, the scanner/leader asks via an all quorum if they're
   still the leader.
 - If they are, then write the shard ranges into my DB and let
   replication spread them out.

This sounds great. But there is an edge case, what happens if the
replication fails? We can't roll back the shard ranges by removing
them locally because the container replicators in the meal while might
have already managed to push somewhere because of a network blip.

For example, what happens if replication is down for that node after writing
the ranges, or the server goes down for maintenence, and a rebalance
happens, and now this "leader" who has shard ranges is a handoff. But
will still offload it's ranges when back online. Even after another leader
has since been elected and replicated a different set of ranges.

This patch is trying solve that edge case by  reducing that potentail gap
between the finding and inserting shard ranges locally and it's eventual
replication.
It does it by taking advantage of the "still leader" quorum. If it still
is the leader after finding shard ranges, it goes and updates the other
primaries using the new container UPDATE verb. So long as one of those
is successful, it's safe to write the shard ranges locally.
If all UPDATEs fail, the scanner safely throws away the ranges and will
have another go when the connection or whatever is back.

It in essence gives us a rollback without having to be smart with
replication locking (locking out the container-replicators) writing and
checking if we managed to replication in the sharder.

This is just a POC to test out the theory, just a possible solution.

The real question is, is the edgecase real? Or can we somehow just be
smarter in replication.

Change-Id: I39f07180ce7990702e4fdfe7e43f313781d7e7d3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/50/672650/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from swift.common.bufferedhttp import http_connect_raw, http_connect def _find_shard_ranges(self, broker, part): :param part: The part the container is a part of, used to make primary node look ups easier # Here's a new approach, sync the shardranges out via container # UPDATE's so long as we get _at_ least 1 success then merge them down. if self._update_containers(part, shard_ranges): broker.merge_shard_ranges(shard_ranges) else: self.logger.warning('Failed to UPDATE found shard ranges to ' 'other primaries. Not writing found ranges') self._increment_stat('scanned', 'failure', statsd=True) return 0 def _update_containers(self, part, shard_ranges): nodes = self.ring.get_part_nodes(part) shard_ranges_data = [dict(s) for s in shard_ranges] # We only need nodes that aren't us. for n in nodes: if self._check_node(n): continue self.cpool.spawn( self._send_update_request, n, shard_ranges_data) responses = [] for resp in self.cpool: if not resp: continue if not is_success(resp.status): continue try: responses.append(json.loads(resp.read())) except ValueError: continue if any(responses): return True return False def _send_update_request(self, node, part, path, shard_ranges_data): headers = {'user-agent': 'container-sharder %s' % os.getpid(), 'X-Timestamp': Timestamp(time.time()).normal, 'x-backend-record-type': RECORD_TYPE_SHARD} try: with ConnectionTimeout(self.conn_timeout): conn = http_connect(node['ip'], node['port'], node['device'], part, 'UPDATE', path, headers) with Timeout(self.node_timeout): conn.send(json.dumps(shard_ranges_data)) with Timeout(self.node_timeout): response = conn.getresponse() return response except (Exception, Timeout) as x: self.logger.info(str(x)) # Need to do something here. return None num_found = self._find_shard_ranges(broker, part)
deleted_lines: from swift.common.bufferedhttp import http_connect_raw def _find_shard_ranges(self, broker): broker.merge_shard_ranges(shard_ranges) # should we attempt to replicate the list so we can roll back if # if replication failed to it's neighbours? I guess we don't know if # the actual container replica's have already gone and done it.. # so a pro if we ever merge the sharder into the replicator. num_found = self._find_shard_ranges(broker)

commit_message:
Support noauth2 auth_strategy

Currently, noauth2 auth_strategy is not supported. If you specify
[DEFAULT]auth_strategy=noauth2 in `/etc/masakari/ masakari.conf`
and start the masakari api service, it gives ImportError.

Added NoAuthMiddleware to support noauth2 auth_strategy.

Closes-Bug: #1836354
Change-Id: I288cd5838b09d3e6c31b6408fff85e6bb5f529a6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/masakari refs/changes/80/670680/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Set option:mtu in inspector dnsmasq

Set the mtu for all subnets in inspector dnsmasq
config to value of 'local_mtu' in undercloud.conf.

Closes-Bug: #1845487
Depends-On: Ic95dbf1867fb5397f1b6d8f23466910a97051cb6

commit_message:
Raising minimum version of oslo.db

oslo.db was not compatible with Python 3.7 until version 4.40.0
because Python 3.7 makes "async" a keyword [1].
To prevent bad surprises, this patch increases the minumum version
required for oslo.db to 4.40.0.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/574833

Change-Id: I3271fd2d7d81261db6da079e55fb87656c833686

commit_message:
Replace the driver name of iptables_v2 with the namespace

The configured driver iptables_v2 has been moved, automatically using
neutron_fwaas.services.firewall.service_drivers.agents.drivers.linux.iptables_fwaas_v2.IptablesFwaasDriver instead. [1]

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/admin/fwaas-v2-scenario.html#enable-fwaas-v2

Change-Id: I2b300d0b7d66029dd631d0b790c46267a5e889e7
Signed-off-by: ZijianGuo <guozijn@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-09-26 01:21:56.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/v1/container_image.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/3cf57669ec8c1d52ae5662967765230895273844', 'message': 'Don't use --registry-url for image show auth

This doesn't work for registries like docker.io because they expect
the authentication url to include the namespace so they can determine
the allowed scope of the request.

Instead the image reference is used for authentication, and the docs
include examples to make it clear that the registry host needs to be
included in the image reference.

This change also makes json the default formatter for the show

Change-Id: I30ce5c53e3eac758f52f31cc9ed3f2dff35eb4cb
Closes-Bug: #1845400
'}]
commit_message:
Don't use --registry-url for image show auth

This doesn't work for registries like docker.io because they expect
the authentication url to include the namespace so they can determine
the allowed scope of the request.

Instead the image reference is used for authentication, and the docs
include examples to make it clear that the registry host needs to be
included in the image reference.

This change also makes json the default formatter for the show
command, so it can be used as a drop-in replacement for "skopeo
inspect" and so that the output format is consistent with the docker
commands.

Change-Id: I30ce5c53e3eac758f52f31cc9ed3f2dff35eb4cb
Closes-Bug: #1845400

commit_message:
Don't raise when raw template files not found during delete

During raw template files delete, if we can't found any files,
just return instead raise NotFound.

Change-Id: I680f1931096a1e20282f769873879c3bdd648a34
Task: 36945

commit_message:
fixtures: Handle iterable params for 'NeutronFixture.list_*'

It turns out it's possible to filter on multiple possible values using
by using an iterable query value. We're going to need this for proper
subnet mocking, so add it now. There's no impact on tests.

Change-Id: Ia02ff34ec94a911906e2e812ab6503d4a2118bce
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/96/686796/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _list_resource(self, resources, retrieve_all, **_params): # If 'fields' is passed we need to strip that out since it will mess # up the filtering as 'fields' is not a filter parameter. _params.pop('fields', None) result = [] for resource in resources.values(): for key, val in _params.items(): # params can be strings or lists/tuples and these need to be # handled differently if isinstance(val, list) or isinstance(val, tuple): if not any(resource.get(key) == v for v in val): break else: if resource.get(key) != val: break else: # triggers if we didn't hit a break above result.append(copy.deepcopy(resource)) return result def list_ports(self, retrieve_all=True, **_params): return {'ports': self._list_resource( self._ports, retrieve_all, **_params)} return {'networks': self._list_resource( self._networks, retrieve_all, **_params)}
deleted_lines: networks = self._networks.values() if 'id' in _params: networks = [x for x in networks if x['id'] in _params['id']] _params.pop('id') networks = [n for n in networks if all(n.get(opt) == _params[opt] for opt in _params)] return {'networks': copy.deepcopy(networks)} def list_ports(self, retrieve_all=True, **_params): # If 'fields' is passed we need to strip that out since it will mess # up the filtering as 'fields' is not a filter parameter. _params.pop('fields', None) ports = [p for p in self._ports.values() if all(p.get(opt) == _params[opt] for opt in _params)] return {'ports': copy.deepcopy(ports)}

commit_message:
fixtures: Beef up NeutronFixture

The sample networks, subnets and ports this used were missing a lot of
fields that the neutron API returns. Beef these up to match something
like what we'd receive from a modern neutron instance. Note that this
does involve some shuffling around of lines, but that's intentional to
make things easier to diff. A future change will add proper security
group and floating IP support.

Change-Id: Ib07303d3ad96110d7d416a3d6e1e9197420f8680
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
nova-net: Migrate 'test_simple_tenant_usage' functional tests

This test case is using common samples and falling back to the v2.37
server create request sample which uses auto-network creation rather
than a specific network ID. As a result, we must mock the relevant
functions from the neutronclient in our NeutronFixture.

Change-Id: I28493775b9135b8fb4d778963a2b227a4d8ed0a2
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add update_reservation to dummy plugin

update_reservation is now an abstract method. It needs to be added to
all plugins.

Change-Id: I921878bd5233613b804b17813af1aac5bdfed9e7

commit_message:
nova-net: Migrate 'test_attach_interfaces' functional tests

This one is a little more involved and I'm not actually sure how it was
working before, since nova-net doesn't seem to support the 'show_port'
method. In short though, we're rewriting stuff to mock or wrap the
neutron implementation of nova's 'network' API. We also get to remove
some unnecessary mocks that the 'NeutronFixture' will now handle for us.

Change-Id: I15323a342d53cebd43f3a645528bc96489f19bc3
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
fixtures: Store 'device_id' when creating port in NeutronFixture

When creating a port, we send a bit of information to neutron, namely,
the requested network, the tenant (project) ID and, crucially, the
device ID. The 'NeutronFixture' should be setting these fields on the
created port but is not. This hasn't been an issue to date but will when
we add subnet support, so fix this now.

Change-Id: Ia842854c12cd2d2ed630d1e0f2bb691859592cd9
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Bump the openstackdocstheme extension to 1.20

Some options are now automatically configured by the version 1.20:
- project
- html_last_updated_fmt
- latex_engine
- latex_elements
- version
- release.

Change-Id: Idaf347c183fe35d346f15b24c0bfad0585b082fc

commit_message:
Use Horizon project template for django jobs

Horizon defined a project template 'horizon-non-primary-django-jobs'
for django jobs. This patch use that template to run django jobs
here. For information please refer [1]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/681969/

Change-Id: I4d312087fdf00d297f5bf1fdef0bd234f8543651

commit_message:
nova-net: Migrate 'test_server_tags' functional tests

Since we already worked on the NeutronFixture to return security groups
in change Ibbee7fd11c1aa254e399d302adbae69126e98262, this now just
works.

Change-Id: Ia9456055bc4defaefa98cfa82484b9ce5c8792e0
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
nova-net: Migrate 'test_quota_sets' functional tests

This one is long because network quotas aren't a thing when using
neutron, which means we need to remove them from all the samples.

Change-Id: I9cb2fb1b3817797a53c1331d666750399a7f5f87
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

subject: Change log level based on node status
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-10-04 12:51:40.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/conductor/task_manager.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/05bf8f69d6eacd562cf3bba82bc7d692c00e8a3e', 'message': "Change log level based on node status

While the status node change message is purely informational, it
can contain also failed states transitions.
Moving the level from INFO to ERROR if the provision_state is
'failed' can help in detecting the transition message when
troubleshooting issues.

Change-Id: I79ff7cb8b9d33bc2837d41126fba269a5d4b1cda
(cherry picked from commit b8fa188a29481b11b2f3117cdeecfd920a8f5a0e)
"}]
commit_message:
Change log level based on node status

While the status node change message is purely informational, it
can contain also failed states transitions.
Moving the level from INFO to ERROR if the provision_state is
'failed' can help in detecting the transition message when
troubleshooting issues.

Change-Id: I79ff7cb8b9d33bc2837d41126fba269a5d4b1cda
(cherry picked from commit b8fa188a29481b11b2f3117cdeecfd920a8f5a0e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/97/686597/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: log_message = ('Node %(node)s moved to provision state "%(state)s" ' 'from state "%(previous)s"; target provision state is ' '"%(target)s"' % {'node': self.node.uuid, 'state': self.node.provision_state, 'target': self.node.target_provision_state, 'previous': self._prev_provision_state}) if (self.node.provision_state.endswith('failed') or self.node.provision_state == 'error'): LOG.error(log_message) else: LOG.info(log_message)
deleted_lines: LOG.info('Node %(node)s moved to provision state "%(state)s" from ' 'state "%(previous)s"; target provision state is ' '"%(target)s"', {'node': self.node.uuid, 'state': self.node.provision_state, 'target': self.node.target_provision_state, 'previous': self._prev_provision_state})

commit_message:
Add mariadb backup capability to mariadb chart

 * backup script for mariadb
 * restore script for mariadb
 * cronjob to control backup automation for mariadb
 * add parameters to values.yaml

Change-Id: Ib0b6744f519ea1919507df0c2a50b45b27ac86ab

commit_message:
nova-net: Migrate 'test_hypervisors' functional tests

There's one less service with nova-network disabled, meaning the host
indexes are off by one. We just use a regex sub to avoid needing to
change this.

Change-Id: I5c8496f7287634a0db50f4545c43aeba33b75e6b
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add support to set option:mtu in inspector dnsmasq

It should be possible to configure the DHCP server to
provide the mtu option for inspection subnets.

This uses the dhcp-option-force so that the option is
provided also when the client does not ask for it.
According to dnsmasq manual page this is sometimes
required when sending options to PXELINUX.

Closes-Bug: #1845487
Change-Id: Ic95dbf1867fb5397f1b6d8f23466910a97051cb6
(cherry picked from commit 03550bc8c8d05583e76c335c465684cec6d55093)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ironic refs/changes/38/685338/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <% if s['mtu'] -%> <% if s['tag'] -%> dhcp-option-force=tag:<%= s['tag'] -%>,option:mtu,<%= s['mtu'] %> <% else -%> dhcp-option-force=option:mtu,<%= s['mtu'] %> <% end -%> <% end -%>

commit_message:
nova-net: Migrate 'test_rescue' functional tests

Since we already worked on the NeutronFixture to return security groups
in change Ibbee7fd11c1aa254e399d302adbae69126e98262, this now just
works.

Change-Id: I16215c4bfddf874c9705d4746f911dfeaac624f6
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix port info lookup parsing

The output format for "openstack port show" has changed breaking the
octavia deployment ansible. This patch changes the output format to json
and uses json_query to parse out the results.

Closes-Bug: #1846399
Change-Id: I3b5c989259fd4347c41d392ad79bfd6b9459d605
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/05/686805/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: openstack port show {{ mgmt_port_id }} -f json -c fixed_ips | jq ".fixed_ips[0] | .ip_address " | tr -d "\"" 2> /dev/null subnet_id=$(openstack port show {{ mgmt_port_id }} -f json -c fixed_ips | jq ".fixed_ips[0] | .subnet_id " | tr -d "\"" 2> /dev/null)
deleted_lines: openstack port show {{ mgmt_port_id }} -f value -c fixed_ips | cut -f1 -d, | cut -f2 -d= | tr -d "'" subnet_id=$(openstack port show {{ mgmt_port_id }} -f value -c fixed_ips | cut -f2 -d, | cut -f2 -d= | tr -d "'" 2> /dev/null)

commit_message:
Use dynamic argument_spec from documentation

This change modifies the argument_spec making it so we load the options
key from the documentation constant. This will reduce the code we have
to maintain and ensure our documentation is always in sync with the
module capabilities.

Change-Id: Ib3e56f94debd6e99d9319902517811cf77ecc874
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

Three tests require modification to specifically request an API that our
NeutronFixture provides. The rest just work (TM).

commit_message:
Add support to set option:mtu in inspector dnsmasq

It should be possible to configure the DHCP server to
provide the mtu option for inspection subnets.

This uses the dhcp-option-force so that the option is
provided also when the client does not ask for it.
According to dnsmasq manual page this is sometimes
required when sending options to PXELINUX.

Closes-Bug: #1845487
Change-Id: Ic95dbf1867fb5397f1b6d8f23466910a97051cb6
(cherry picked from commit 03550bc8c8d05583e76c335c465684cec6d55093)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ironic refs/changes/35/685335/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <% if s['mtu'] -%> <% if s['tag'] -%> dhcp-option-force=tag:<%= s['tag'] -%>,option:mtu,<%= s['mtu'] %> <% else -%> dhcp-option-force=option:mtu,<%= s['mtu'] %> <% end -%> <% end -%>

commit_message:
tests: Correctly mock out security groups in NeutronFixture

For our immediate purposes, this should always return something so we
modify the mock to do just that. That requires some modifications to
existing tests but is otherwise pretty simple. A future change will
address the TODO contained within to properly mock the neutron API.

Change-Id: Ibbee7fd11c1aa254e399d302adbae69126e98262
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Change log level based on node status

While the status node change message is purely informational, it
can contain also failed states transitions.
Moving the level from INFO to ERROR if the provision_state is
'failed' can help in detecting the transition message when
troubleshooting issues.

Change-Id: I79ff7cb8b9d33bc2837d41126fba269a5d4b1cda
(cherry picked from commit b8fa188a29481b11b2f3117cdeecfd920a8f5a0e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/95/686595/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: log_message = ('Node %(node)s moved to provision state "%(state)s" ' 'from state "%(previous)s"; target provision state is ' '"%(target)s"' % {'node': self.node.uuid, 'state': self.node.provision_state, 'target': self.node.target_provision_state, 'previous': self._prev_provision_state}) if (self.node.provision_state.endswith('failed') or self.node.provision_state == 'error'): LOG.error(log_message) else: LOG.info(log_message)
deleted_lines: LOG.info('Node %(node)s moved to provision state "%(state)s" from ' 'state "%(previous)s"; target provision state is ' '"%(target)s"', {'node': self.node.uuid, 'state': self.node.provision_state, 'target': self.node.target_provision_state, 'previous': self._prev_provision_state})

commit_message:
Change log level based on node status

While the status node change message is purely informational, it
can contain also failed states transitions.
Moving the level from INFO to ERROR if the provision_state is
'failed' can help in detecting the transition message when
troubleshooting issues.

Change-Id: I79ff7cb8b9d33bc2837d41126fba269a5d4b1cda
(cherry picked from commit b8fa188a29481b11b2f3117cdeecfd920a8f5a0e)

subject: [Unit tests] Skip TestWSGIServer with IPv6 if no IPv6 enabled
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-28 10:42:51.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/test_wsgi.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/6906c4017fb1df525fd5b6c7eefb88e5c8b67ceb', 'message': "[Unit tests] Skip TestWSGIServer with IPv6 if no IPv6 enabled

Test test_wsgi.TestWSGIServer.test_start_random_port_with_ipv6
is trying to spawn server and bind it to local IPv6 address.
In case when this test is run on host with disabled support
for IPv6 it shouldn't fails but should be skipped.

This patch adds such skip if IPv6 is disabled on host.

Change-Id: I3f7fc20a063757db78fa44c62312a9fcf96a3071
"}]
commit_message:
[Unit tests] Skip TestWSGIServer with IPv6 if no IPv6 enabled

Test test_wsgi.TestWSGIServer.test_start_random_port_with_ipv6
is trying to spawn server and bind it to local IPv6 address.
In case when this test is run on host with disabled support
for IPv6 it shouldn't fails but should be skipped.

This patch adds such skip if IPv6 is disabled on host.

Change-Id: I3f7fc20a063757db78fa44c62312a9fcf96a3071
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/57/578757/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.common import ipv6_utils @testtools.skipIf( not ipv6_utils.is_enabled_and_bind_by_default(), 'IPv6 support disabled on host')

commit_message:
Delete the ca-rotate api-ref
'ca-rotate' hasn't been supported, 'ERROR: 'rotate_ca_certificate'
is not supported by this driver (HTTP 400)' will be returned.
So, I think we should supply the api after it's realization.

Change-Id: I698b9df3876dd9fa4e1685973762d92ec3a5f7ca

stable/train.

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Change-Id: I774dcf899f3446aa052e6d1f0075d77d753c8897

commit_message:
Return default quota from API

Currently the dashboard and magnum clients are unable to get the default
quota of a project, if a project does not have a quota set. This is due
to the API returning a QuotaNotFound exception, rather than falling back
to the default quota.

The result is that dashboard is not displaying quotas correctly. It also
means users are not able to see their default quota.

This patch updates the API by returning the default quota instead of a
QuotaNotFound exception. This makes magnum behave similarly to how other
projects like designate handles quota.

Story: 2006307
Task: 36029
Change-Id: I1b278d221d0f15d92d67869cd3ac897d041eaf90
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/82/673782/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Extend timeout for database migration tests

Database migration tests (specifically test_walk_versions
and test_mysql_innodb) are failing due to multiple reasons
from oslo.db side mentioned in the code comments.
Increasing the timeout will allow the tests to execute
successfully on slower nodes.
This solution is adopted from manila [1] and also implemented
in neutron [2] for the same and hopefully they're not facing the
issue currently.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/291397/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/610003/

Change-Id: I31bdcfc12e3b8b54d5b5a6664f88df3b7dcd4fc0
(cherry picked from commit ad0b6691e2a85d4b36978d02953dca2c289a82e6)
Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/unit/db/test_migrations.py

commit_message:
Added changes to avoid building of deploy iso when provided

This commit adds change in ironic devstack plugin to avoid
deploy iso image from getting created when 'IRONIC_DEPLOY_ISO_REQUIRED'
is true and deploy iso is provided.

Change-Id: Ie7b417001687c19aed001e74f5c40dfd0ddde5cc
Closes-bug: #1680763

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I2d12c004935e02782ce8ea046d1f039298d35382

commit_message:
Propagate cloud_provider_enabled correctly

The derived cloud_provider_enabled is placed inside extra_params so that
openstack-cloud-controller-manager gets applied correctly. This required
change was unfortulately missed in https://review.opendev.org/681922.

Additionally improve  the docs related to cloud_provider_enabled label.

Story: 2006531
Task: 36740

Change-Id: I4a89d25b467edd2c4be608c37055706e4e62d78b
(cherry picked from commit 459e27e688d4cd9209060c277e17823c698ee5ac)

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I0554ff1d53c3f4c34d5fa5cfa4bfdc7acddda578

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I49dddfc9a50f757424a517fa6e34ca0d31ddb872

commit_message:
[opensuse] Move opensuse driver to main tree

This patch includes the changes needed to align the opensuse
driver to the other drivers in the magnum/drivers and removes the
driver from contrib/drivers.

Implements: blueprint k8s-opensuse-support
Change-Id: Id228b6d68d873eb2a45503ccd66b5c465ee16c70

commit_message:
Check the size of instance name before creating certificate

When the size of instance name is greater then 52, send 'FAILURE'
to heat.

Change-Id: Ica22c12e7cf4191ba4012947bac087a03f8b6ca4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/11/589711/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # check size for CN: The max size of common name (CN) from SSL certificate is 64. # the size of 'system:node:' is 12, so the size of instance name <= 52. len=$(echo $INSTANCE_NAME | wc -L) if [ $len -gt 52 ] then $WAIT_CURL $VERIFY_CA --data-binary '{"status": "FAILURE", "reason": "The size of instance name $INSTANCE_NAME should not greater than 52."}' fi

subject: Don't use hostname on subjectAltName
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-08-08 02:43:14.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/drivers/common/templates/kubernetes/fragments/make-cert-client.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum/commit/4b3981fa140cc3ddcb5a9c4add55cc0687d2a303', 'message': "Don't use hostname on subjectAltName

The kubelet kubeconfig use instance name, not hostname which
contains '.novalocal'. So the cert file just need instance name.
BTW, if the size of instance name is 63, the cert file can't use
hostname. The size of subjectAltName must '< 64'.

Change-Id: I7eb7078cc9ad3f0e026b5cb2019904904d5f64b8
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use hostname on subjectAltName

The kubelet kubeconfig use instance name, not hostname which
contains '.novalocal'. So the cert file just need instance name.
BTW, if the size of instance name is 63, the cert file can't use
hostname. The size of subjectAltName must '< 64'.

Change-Id: I7eb7078cc9ad3f0e026b5cb2019904904d5f64b8

commit_message:
Remove etcd.service dependency for flannel-config.service

If not remove etcd dependency for flannel-config, when etcd is not 
ready(but etcd will start success finally),the flannel-config service 
will excute failed,and not restart again

Actually,/usr/local/bin/flannel-config will  write flannel config when
etcd become ready,use

    "while ! curl -sf -L $ETCD_CURL_OPTIONS \
            $FLANNEL_ETCD_ENDPOINTS/v2/keys${FLANNEL_ETCD_PREFIX}/config
            -X PUT --data-urlencode value@${FLANNEL_JSON}; do
        echo "waiting for etcd"
        sleep 1
    done"

So let's remove this dependency

Change-Id: I5eb3faa6af89ade0301486470318193830e109cd

commit_message:
Only allow pull from heat in os-collect-config

We for now, only use heat for os-collect-config, so we shouldn't
allow it to try to pull from other sources. That will increase
unrequired (and undesired) bandwith.

Change-Id: I6cb44c97c4f6ff685d78c19d4e33b3c811bfc43e

commit_message:
[api-ref]Host name is not necessary to contain '@'

As shown in https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/e39652d2dc8f4cb394933da8f9a9bb59/log/job-output.txt,
host name may contain '@', but not necessary to contain '@',
like:
Request (VolumeHostsV3RbacTest:test_show_host):
200 GET https://10.208.227.163/volume/v3/67d6a092ee7d4cd4a6b3ae37812bec50/os-hosts/ubuntu-bionic-rax-dfw-0010673901
Response Body: {"host":
                 [{"resource":
                   {"volume_count": "2", "total_volume_gb": "2",
                    "total_snapshot_gb": "1", "project": "(total)",
                    "host": "ubuntu-bionic-rax-dfw-0010673901",
                    "snapshot_count": "1"}},
                  {"resource":
                   {"volume_count": "1", "total_volume_gb": "1",
                     "total_snapshot_gb": "0",
                     "project": "2aba5d9825ac47a7b8c3ea805af34a75",
                     "host": "ubuntu-bionic-rax-dfw-0010673901",
                     "snapshot_count": "0"}}}

Besides, the format 'host@backend' should be that of host_name_backend,
not host.

Change-Id: Id2c0be1e4d0471686674ef781b722087638c4c50
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/83/679883/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add context to cloning snapshots in remotefs driver

Adds context to _create_cloned_volume method in order
to allow taking a snapshot during cloning. Also saves
the temp_snapshot in order to enable Nova to update the
snapshot state. Destroys the temp_snapshot after usage.
This affects the NFS, WindowsSMBFS, VZStorage and
Quobyte drivers.

Closes-Bug: #1744692

Change-Id: I328a02d0f26e8c3d41ec18a0487da6fd20b39b04
(cherry picked from commit 78f2101fc5a84e81132e6c2adc89cfe681018d77)
(cherry picked from commit 247c6607156da6f4403c4826c7d2e09720c43e8d)

added_lines: from cinder import objects def _create_cloned_volume(self, volume, src_vref, context): kwargs = { 'volume_id': src_vref.id, 'user_id': context.user_id, 'project_id': context.project_id, 'status': fields.SnapshotStatus.CREATING, 'progress': '0%', 'volume_size': src_vref.size, 'display_name': 'tmp-snap-%s' % src_vref.id, 'display_description': None, 'volume_type_id': src_vref.volume_type_id, 'encryption_key_id': src_vref.encryption_key_id, } temp_snapshot = objects.Snapshot(context=context, **kwargs) temp_snapshot.create() # remove temp snapshot after the cloning is done temp_snapshot.status = fields.SnapshotStatus.DELETING temp_snapshot.context = context.elevated() temp_snapshot.save() temp_snapshot.destroy() snapshot.obj_context, s = db.snapshot_get(snapshot.obj_context, snapshot.id) return self._create_cloned_volume(volume, src_vref, src_vref.obj_context) return self._create_cloned_volume(volume, src_vref, src_vref.obj_context)
deleted_lines: def _create_cloned_volume(self, volume, src_vref): snap_attrs = ['volume_name', 'volume_size', 'name', 'volume_id', 'id', 'volume'] Snapshot = collections.namedtuple('Snapshot', snap_attrs) temp_snapshot = Snapshot(volume_name=volume_name, volume_size=src_vref.size, name='clone-snap-%s' % src_vref.id, volume_id=src_vref.id, id='tmp-snap-%s' % src_vref.id, volume=src_vref) context = snapshot._context context, s = db.snapshot_get(context, snapshot.id) return self._create_cloned_volume(volume, src_vref) return self._create_cloned_volume(volume, src_vref)

commit_message:
Don't allow retype to encrypted+multiattach type

This maintains consistency with our policy of not allowing the
combination of encryption and multiattach in commit
18327971ca7231807294a6b1dbf3d80c23cb6796

Change-Id: I1c22bc86d96bb1cab80c004d3450b1dac6c4a769
(cherry picked from commit 293be4f81b6b219e2651bc2f5b8b8c63b8883165)

(cherry picked from commit 4adaa86f904f7071e0f8b79ee2e204d3d1a26fd1)

subject: Fix ceph: only close rbd image after snapshot iteration is finished
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-13 20:16:31.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/backup/drivers/ceph.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/9e5d33ac244e8dce31ff6d2c7119ee4bd53a9908', 'message': "Fix ceph: only close rbd image after snapshot iteration is finished

list_snaps() returns an iterator object that requires resources from the
Image object. Closing the Image object deallocates these resources.

On Ceph mimic, which contains changes to the functions being invoked,
iterating over the snapshots of a closed image results in the following
assertion being triggered:

cinder-backup[29383]: /build/ceph-13.2.2/src/common/Mutex.cc: In function 'void Mutex::Lock(bool)' thread 7f35a4812700 time 2018-12-14 10:10:49.843120
cinder-backup[29383]: /build/ceph-13.2.2/src/common/Mutex.cc: 110: FAILED assert(r == 0)
cinder-backup[29383]:  ceph version 13.2.2 (02899bfda814146b021136e9d8e80eba494e1126) mimic (stable)
cinder-backup[29383]:  1: (ceph::__ceph_assert_fail(char const*, char const*, int, char const*)+0x102) [0x7f35903440f2]
cinder-backup[29383]:  2: (()+0x3162b7) [0x7f35903442b7]
cinder-backup[29383]:  3: (Mutex::Lock(bool)+0x1de) [0x7f359031901e]

cinder-backup[29383]:  5: (()+0x11280d) [0x7f358db7f80d]
cinder-backup[29383]:  6: (rbd_snap_get_namespace_type()+0x29) [0x7f358dacf549]

The lock being tried to acquire and the object that contained it have
already been destroyed by closing the image. The assertion terminates
the cinder-backup service via SIGABRT.

On Ceph luminous we've seen occasional segfaults of the cinder-backup
service, which might have the same underlying cause.

Closes-Bug: #1838691

commit_message:
Fix ceph: only close rbd image after snapshot iteration is finished

list_snaps() returns an iterator object that requires resources from the
Image object. Closing the Image object deallocates these resources.

On Ceph mimic, which contains changes to the functions being invoked,
iterating over the snapshots of a closed image results in the following
assertion being triggered:

cinder-backup[29383]: /build/ceph-13.2.2/src/common/Mutex.cc: In function 'void Mutex::Lock(bool)' thread 7f35a4812700 time 2018-12-14 10:10:49.843120
cinder-backup[29383]: /build/ceph-13.2.2/src/common/Mutex.cc: 110: FAILED assert(r == 0)
cinder-backup[29383]:  ceph version 13.2.2 (02899bfda814146b021136e9d8e80eba494e1126) mimic (stable)
cinder-backup[29383]:  1: (ceph::__ceph_assert_fail(char const*, char const*, int, char const*)+0x102) [0x7f35903440f2]
cinder-backup[29383]:  2: (()+0x3162b7) [0x7f35903442b7]
cinder-backup[29383]:  3: (Mutex::Lock(bool)+0x1de) [0x7f359031901e]
cinder-backup[29383]:  4: (()+0x8f452) [0x7f358dafc452]
cinder-backup[29383]:  5: (()+0x11280d) [0x7f358db7f80d]
cinder-backup[29383]:  6: (rbd_snap_get_namespace_type()+0x29) [0x7f358dacf549]

The lock being tried to acquire and the object that contained it have
already been destroyed by closing the image. The assertion terminates
the cinder-backup service via SIGABRT.

On Ceph luminous we've seen occasional segfaults of the cinder-backup
service, which might have the same underlying cause.

Closes-Bug: #1838691

Change-Id: If6043d82cc57d9247a290816d90b95cdf719eaac
Signed-off-by: Sven Wegener <sven.wegener@inovex.de>
(cherry picked from commit 76569672599eda764f946ad6ee2ce0bdaddad36b)
(cherry picked from commit e78b220f448c7eb0de35aafd1d49b00547384d41)
(cherry picked from commit 57b127459189e39e993426f8e401e288f6394d4b)

commit_message:
[suse] Add custom etcd service configuration based on static IPs

In specific scenarios without access to outside network. There will no be
possibility to use etcd discovery service from http://discovery.etcd.io.  
For this cases we have to initialize etcd cluster based on static IP's.  
 
To use this functionality, please setup --discovery-url as none during
creating Kubernetes cluster.

Change-Id: I458e716b96d2515fee7b8af2eee7027e21c11fa5
Partial-Bug: #1622949

commit_message:
Scaling down the node which runs less pods

When user scales down the nodes, the get_removal_nodes() of
scale_manager.py can not get the node which contains less pods.
This patch can delete the node which contains no pods firstly,
then delete the node which containes less pods.

Change-Id: I755afae294059ff53686824fff127127efc96fbc
Closes-Bug: #1600125

commit_message:
Make kubernetes backend support keystone v3

Kubernetes backend only support keystone v2 at this point,
make it support keystone v3.
Closes-Bug: #1645610

Change-Id: I7bc3ab8453eb4f20e523e3260ffedf33b64d4af9

commit_message:
magnum support cni network driver

As known, k8s can provide cni network plugin for containers,
but magnum can not support config cni for coe k8s.
We add --network-plugin=cni to kubelet command line in configure-
kubernetes-minions.
More informations about cni network plugin can be
seen in https://kubernetes.io/docs/admin/network-plugins.

Change-Id: Icf66a9f287a215bacc2fa03c983e3383bf3faaee
Implements: blueprint magnum-support-cni-network-driver

commit_message:
[WIP] Add NodeGroups with v2 API

Adds v2 API folder structure including cluster,
cluster_template, and adding nodegroup files. Mostly a
sandbox implementation for now. Adds some /v1 functions
via /v2 path for ClusterTemplate.

Change-Id: I253937140b4d409384cedf4e5754386ff796ceee
Implements: blueprint nodegroups

commit_message:
Allow deletion of clusters with unsupported driver

Closes-Bug: #1646215
Change-Id: I387e73c4ed6d1ac6d8e4f454ccaabee9e73b024a

commit_message:
WIP: Improving Error Handling

When cloud-init scripts fail, magnum does not convey to API users
what went wrong during the failed cluster create attempt.

This patch demonstrates how to use a heat waitcondition
to surface the reason. This tests for basic name resolution and
network connectivity for the API endpoints. If these tests fail,
then so will the cluster create process.

This short circuits the cluster create processing so the error
is surfaced in the first few seconds of processing, rather
than waiting for a timeout to elapse.

Change-Id: Ib68038e1ce76e761a4dac5146b6a13ed49d0e55c
Partial-Bug: 1669056

commit_message:
Update Dev Quickstart for Xenial

The current quickstart says it is only tested for ubuntu 14.04
(trustry) but the current devstack no longer works with trusty.
This patch updates the quickstart guide iwith working instructions
for Ubuntu 16.04.2 (Xenial).

Change-Id: If4c4630bb7b634147920e98eeb4cf9bd43bb08c1
Closes-Bug: #1677399

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-26 21:48:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum/commit/8e118a9bd56b56c8729f4fa2847eea57a67459f4', 'message': "Add external CA certs to cluster template

Magnum requires that a cluster connects to different public API's
(Identity API for trustee user authentication, Magnum API for
certificate storing, Heat API for wait condition notification, etc).
If API endpoint is configured with HTTPS, connection will fail server
certificate validation, unless public API is configured with
commercial TLS certificate, issued by CA from Mozilla approved CA list.

This patch allows passing in of an optional CA certificate to cluster
template, which can be used for server certificate validation when
connecting to public URLs. This cert will be passed into the cluster
at creation time and added to the CA bundle.

An associated patch will be included for magnumclient to upload a cert.

commit_message:
Add external CA certs to cluster template

Magnum requires that cluster connects to different public API's
(Identity API for trustee user authentication, Magnum API for
certificate storing, Heat API for wait condition notification, etc).
If API endpoint is configured with HTTPS, connection will fail server
certificate validation, unless public API is configured with
commercial TLS certificate, issued by CA from Mozilla approved CA list.

This patch introduces a new setting add_ext_ca_cert in [cluster]
section of magnum.conf file. Content of this file will be passed into
cluster nodes at creation time and added to the CA bundle.

CA certificate injection is implemented for k8s_atomic, k8s_coreos,
swarm-atomic and ubuntu_mesos. For k8s_opensuse and k8s_ironic, only
parameter was added to parent template to avoid InvalidParameterValue
error. Implementation is to be added separately.

This review supecedes https://review.openstack.org/315178

Change-Id: Ic9cb2f0f25f7bbfe8e14b1a72fab6d5002518aac
Closes-Bug: 1580704

commit_message:
Make sure the wsgi script dir mode is 0755

When the system-wide umask setting is more restrictive than the
default setting, the wsgi script directory permissions may not allow
the apache process to access them, resulting in errors.

A similar fix was applied to Keystone some time ago, see [1].

[1] - https://github.com/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/4f15fb64b1cb60388efbee75acbfb3b13a8fa1f6

Change-Id: Ie9769657dc530bc895a3119b3e458864a8b5f293

commit_message:
Make sure the wsgi script dir mode is 0755

When the system-wide umask setting is more restrictive than the
default setting, the wsgi script directory permissions may not allow
the apache process to access them, resulting in errors.

A similar fix was applied to Keystone some time ago, see [1].

[1] - https://github.com/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/4f15fb64b1cb60388efbee75acbfb3b13a8fa1f6

Change-Id: Ie9769657dc530bc895a3119b3e458864a8b5f293
(cherry picked from commit 33b05434f3e17f394ec1a39959adcfd46d361e06)
(cherry picked from commit e2e70bb6b927944e8dc3dd2ea587257055953fa5)

subject: Restore defaults for combine and failonfail in openstack command
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-09-18 08:13:18.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/openstack.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstacklib/commit/4d0e91cf6e14bfa732b1319e95b4ce9d193d9f83', 'message': 'Restore defaults for combine and failonfail in openstack command

[1] added "override_locale: false" to the openstack command executions,
to respect the current locale. This had an unintended side effect,
since it changed the values for failonfail and combine to false in
that same execution, as described in [2].

We should ensure that openstack command failures are respected, so
this commit restores that behavior.

[1] - https://review.opendev.org/640997
[2] - https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppet/blob/master/lib/puppet/util/execution.rb#L139-L143

Change-Id: I55e587ea5c83338ae989aa56f1f379079eb02e08
(cherry picked from commit 726b06cdb49426719a13be3f02bcce72a697484c)
'}]
commit_message:
Restore defaults for combine and failonfail in openstack command

[1] added "override_locale: false" to the openstack command executions,
to respect the current locale. This had an unintended side effect,
since it changed the values for failonfail and combine to false in
that same execution, as described in [2].

We should ensure that openstack command failures are respected, so
this commit restores that behavior.

[1] - https://review.opendev.org/640997
[2] - https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppet/blob/master/lib/puppet/util/execution.rb#L139-L143

Change-Id: I55e587ea5c83338ae989aa56f1f379079eb02e08
(cherry picked from commit 726b06cdb49426719a13be3f02bcce72a697484c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstacklib refs/changes/24/682824/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: execute([command(:openstack_command)] + args, override_locale: false, failonfail: true, combine: true)

added_lines: #!/bin/sh -xe # Create an selinux module to allow k8s cluster to create. # k8s-node.te was generated using: # grep denied /var/log/audit/audit.log | audit2allow -m k8s-node semodule_dir=$(mktemp -d) cleanup() { rm -rf $semodule_dir } trap cleanup EXIT cat >> $semodule_dir/k8s-node.te <<EOF module k8s-node 1.0; require { type initrc_t; type init_t; type NetworkManager_t; type unconfined_service_t; type sshd_t; type chkpwd_t; type unconfined_t; type iptables_t; type container_runtime_t; type systemd_machined_t; type lvm_t; type kernel_t; type nfsd_t; type systemd_gpt_generator_t; class process { noatsecure rlimitinh siginh }; class netlink_route_socket { read write }; class netlink_xfrm_socket { read write }; class unix_stream_socket { read write }; } #============= NetworkManager_t ============== allow NetworkManager_t initrc_t:process { noatsecure rlimitinh siginh }; #============= init_t ============== allow init_t NetworkManager_t:process { noatsecure rlimitinh }; allow init_t chkpwd_t:process { noatsecure rlimitinh siginh }; allow init_t container_runtime_t:process { noatsecure rlimitinh }; allow init_t initrc_t:process { noatsecure rlimitinh siginh }; allow init_t kernel_t:unix_stream_socket { read write }; allow init_t lvm_t:process { noatsecure rlimitinh }; allow init_t nfsd_t:process { noatsecure rlimitinh }; allow init_t systemd_gpt_generator_t:process { noatsecure rlimitinh }; allow init_t systemd_machined_t:process { noatsecure rlimitinh }; allow init_t unconfined_service_t:process { noatsecure rlimitinh siginh }; allow init_t unconfined_t:process { rlimitinh siginh }; #============= iptables_t ============== allow iptables_t container_runtime_t:netlink_route_socket { read write }; allow iptables_t container_runtime_t:netlink_xfrm_socket { read write }; #============= sshd_t ============== allow sshd_t chkpwd_t:process { noatsecure rlimitinh siginh }; EOF checkmodule -M -m -o $semodule_dir/k8s-node.mod $semodule_dir/k8s-node.te semodule_package -o $semodule_dir/k8s-node.pp -m $semodule_dir/k8s-node.mod semodule -i $semodule_dir/k8s-node.pp # Turn on SELinux enforcement setenforce 1 # Turn on logging of AVC messages in /var/log/audit/audit.log semodule -DB

commit_message:
[suse] Disable iptables rules created by Docker

All iptables rules created by Docker are useless,
when K8s networking is in place. We have to disable
iptables rules created by Docker in K8s cluster.

Change-Id: I1f7613678a29b016276d7fc23949b7cd09f34652
Closes-Bug: #1668569
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/16/438916/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # In case if DOCKER_NETWORK_OPTIONS exist remove this line sed -i '/^DOCKER_NETWORK_OPTIONS=/d' /etc/sysconfig/docker # Add DOCKER_NETWORK_OPTIONS to Docker configuration echo "DOCKER_NETWORK_OPTIONS=\"--iptables=false --bip=$FLANNEL_SUBNET --mtu=$FLANNEL_MTU\"" >> /etc/sysconfig/docker
deleted_lines: if `grep -q DOCKER_NETWORK_OPTIONS /etc/sysconfig/docker`; then sed -i ' /^DOCKER_NETWORK_OPTIONS=/ s|=.*|="--bip='"$FLANNEL_SUBNET"' --mtu='"$FLANNEL_MTU"'"| ' /etc/sysconfig/docker else echo "DOCKER_NETWORK_OPTIONS=\"--bip=$FLANNEL_SUBNET --mtu=$FLANNEL_MTU\"" >> /etc/sysconfig/docker fi sed -i ' /^DOCKER_OPTS=/ s/=.*/="--storage-driver=btrfs"/ ' /etc/sysconfig/docker

commit_message:
PowerMax Docs Stein - clarifying information

1.  The note is not applicable to Stein as the fix was made before Stein GA.
2.  Decision was made to extend VMAX Hybrid support beyond Train.
This clarification is applicable only to Stein.

Change-Id: I7d9192a1ac5f5da86923359ece981b8d9dd93881
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/27/676227/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 8000, VMAX All Flash 250F, 450F, 850F and 950F and VMAX Hybrid.
deleted_lines: 8000, VMAX All Flash 250F, 450F, 850F and 950F and VMAX Hybrid. Please note That we will no longer be supporting the VMAX Hybrid in the ``T`` release of OpenStack. .. note:: KNOWN ISSUE: Workload support was dropped in PowerMax OS 5978. If a VMAX All Flash array is upgraded to PowerMax OS 5978 or greater and existing volume types leveraged workload i.e. DSS, DSS_REP, OLTP and OLTP_REP, attaching and detaching will no longer work and the volume type will be unusable. Refrain from upgrading to PowerMax OS 5978 or greater on an All Flash until a fix is merged. Please contact your Dell EMC PowerMax customer support representative if in any doubt.

commit_message:
Update default ref name for Gitea

With the change from CGIT to Gitea, branch refs need to be passed
differently. Unfortunately we missed correcting the default value
for falling back to the master branch. Correct it now.

Change-Id: I5233ede99f7f522425b7f553b26115bdcaa787ce

commit_message:
Added os-brick adjustments in the Image Encryption spec

A description for the changes in os-brick is added to this spec.

Change-Id: Icc5a393b6ed5ab162d2456531500de0508949251
Co-Authored-By: Markus Hentsch <markus.hentsch@secustack.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder-specs refs/changes/30/679630/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The methods for encryption and decryption of files - in this case images - will be written in a driver like manner in os-brick so the image encryption can be extended with another encryption format easily. The encryption driver should focus a specific encryption format and implement exactly one encrypt and one decrypt method, both based on a cipher implementation of GPG aes. This driver may be simple wrappers around an existing implementation. An abstract base class should be defined and be used for the implementation of GPG encryption (and might be used for other implementations in the future). * To use the encoding and decoding of images in os-brick, we need to* Add encryption and decryption methods for the GPG format in os-brick * - Train
deleted_lines: * To use the encoding and decoding of images in the library, we need to * - Stein

commit_message:
Rollback the volume_types table when failed to update quota_usages

We create a new volume based on a volume type, then update the volume
type name to a new name of 255 characters in length.
When updating the volume type table, the quota_usages table is updated
synchronously. If DB error occurs in the quota_usages table, we need to
roll back the volume types table.Otherwise, when the volume is deleted,
the information of the quota_usages table will not be updated.

Closes-bug: #1802430
Related-Bug: #1608849

Change-Id: I040ccde7f04ae39258afd9b7322c939c8d796bde

commit_message:
Make backup_compression_algorithm case insensitive

Disaling compression is done by setting the
backup_compression_algorithm config option to None. The valid values is
has the option of "none" but our documentation stated "None". This
caused an error, but should be allowed.

Closes-bug: #1823852

Change-Id: I5ae6e715117d0e89a9d2641602f6b70a0ce94c69
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/09/651209/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
VNX: delete the LUN from VNX backend

Async migration is used in the process of creating a volume from a
snapshot and an internal temp snapshot is created.

Because the temp snapshot isn't deleted, the LUN hosting the temp
snapshot cannot be deleted from the VNX storage.

For example, a new volume, V2, is created from snapshot S1 of volume V1.
An internal temp snapshot S2 is created from copying S1. V1 now has two
snapshots, S1 and S2. Although we delete V1, V2 and S1 from Cinder,
S2 which is Cinder user-invisible isn't deleted and which causes V1 left
on VNX too.

The fix makes sure the snapshot S2 is deleted. Then the delay deletion
on V1 can be executed successfully.

Change-Id: Ib86729488ebfb0aea5d5d4f815a64e00258040e7
Closes-bug: #1794646

commit_message:
Fix code-block JSON format issues

Sphinx 2.0 is more strict on enforcing proper format for the specified
code type. This resulted in a few warnings due to JSON code blocks not
being valid JSON. This cleans up a few cases that were not properly
formatted.

Closes-bug: #1822891

Change-Id: Id6fa50b759add5d2286b98f1752a7ff92bf0515d
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
