subject: Refresh the Service.service_id after re-spawning children
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-01-11 08:53:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/dbdb8e6b8935abfcc47ba32a472e47fabe35fed3', 'message': 'Refresh the Service.service_id after re-spawning children

Currently, the oslo.service provider a mechanism that the main process
will re-spawn the children as necessary. But if we kill the children
service, the services (except the latest service) are always down
after re-spawn.

This reason of this problem is that the Service.service_id is inherited
from the parent process [1] (the parent Service service id class
attribute) and has been recorded as the last created service [2][3]
when latest process is stared. But when re-spawning child process,
only start() method would be called[1], so that the Service.service_id
is not refreshed as expected.

In order to refresh the Service class attribute service_id, we
should get service from db, and then reset the Service.service_id
in child process.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.service/blob/d987a4a/oslo_service/service.py#L648
[2] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/099b141/cinder/service.py#L193
[3] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/099b141/cinder/service.py#L344

Change-Id: Ibefda81215c5081634876a2064b15638388ae921
Closes-bug: #1811344
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-01-17 02:24:21.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/service.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_service.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/40127d95a9e83e97970dc388c18c99eea7715edc', 'message': 'Refresh the Service.service_id after re-spawning children

Currently, the oslo.service provider a mechanism that the main process
will re-spawn the children as necessary. But if we kill the children
service, the services (except the latest service) are always down
after re-spawn.

This reason of this problem is that the Service.service_id is inherited
from the parent process [1] (the parent Service service id class
attribute) and has been recorded as the last created service [2][3]
when latest process is stared. But when re-spawning child process,
only start() method would be called[1], so that the Service.service_id
is not refreshed as expected.

In order to refresh the Service class attribute service_id, we
should store the service_id in instance attr origin_service_id, and set
the class attr back using the instance attribute in start method.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.service/blob/d987a4a/oslo_service/service.py#L648
[2] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/099b141/cinder/service.py#L193
[3] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/099b141/cinder/service.py#L344

Change-Id: Ibefda81215c5081634876a2064b15638388ae921
Closes-bug: #1811344
'}]
commit_message:
Refresh the Service.service_id after re-spawning children

Currently, the oslo.service provider a mechanism that the main process
will re-spawn the children as necessary. But if we kill the children
service, the services (except the latest service) are always down
after re-spawn.

This reason of this problem is that the Service.service_id is inherited
from the parent process [1] (the parent Service service id class
attribute) and has been recorded as the last created service [2][3]
when latest process is stared. But when re-spawning child process,
only start() method would be called[1], so that the Service.service_id
is not refreshed as expected.

In order to refresh the Service class attribute service_id, we
should store the service_id in instance attr origin_service_id, and set
the class attr back using the instance attribute in start method.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.service/blob/d987a4a/oslo_service/service.py#L648
[2] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/099b141/cinder/service.py#L193
[3] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/099b141/cinder/service.py#L344

Change-Id: Ibefda81215c5081634876a2064b15638388ae921
Closes-bug: #1811344
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/68/630068/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_start_refresh_serivce_id(self): serv = service.Service('test', 'test', 'test', 'cinder.tests.unit.test_service.FakeManager') # records the original service id serv_id = serv.service_id # update service id to other value service.Service.service_id = serv_id + 1 serv.start() # After start the service id is refreshed to original service_id self.assertEqual(serv_id, service.Service.service_id) get_by_args.side_effect = exception.NotFound() get_by_id.side_effect = db_exc.DBConnectionError() get_by_args.side_effect = exception.NotFound() get_by_id.side_effect = db_exc.DBError()
deleted_lines: get_by_args.side_effect = exception.NotFound() get_by_id.side_effect = db_exc.DBConnectionError() get_by_args.side_effect = exception.NotFound() get_by_id.side_effect = db_exc.DBError()

commit_message:
Fix CI

This combines the following two patches which need to be landed together
to fix the stable branches. Additionally disable beaker until we can
land this patch.

Pin rake

rake 13.0.0 requires ruby 2.1.0.

Closes-Bug: #1845649
(cherry picked from commit 05ab5cc248a5708036ed27ae13a6f5d5e3bb8d1d)

Pin minitest

minitest 5.12.1[1] requires ruby ~>2.3.

[1] https://rubygems.org/gems/minitest/versions/5.12.1

Closes-Bug: #1845785
(cherry picked from commit 574c5bfd3bb645edd6b180e6d36b44e9beb10d77)

Change-Id: I4fca85f29fe1984707d500e1b87a0227cf4779dc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack_spec_helper refs/changes/94/685494/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
fix logger names

Most files are using getLogger(__name__) so that logging statements
are associated with the file they came from, but there are several
places where this practice has not been followed. This changes to
use __name__ consistently for most code. Per review comments,
commands and wsgi apps are instead updated to use the command/app
name.

Change-Id: Ic2594b88dd818df5486800e4759848d43edc24d1

commit_message:
Fix CI

This combines the following two patches which need to be landed together
to fix the stable branches. Additionally disable beaker until we can
land this patch.

Pin rake

rake 13.0.0 requires ruby 2.1.0.

Closes-Bug: #1845649
(cherry picked from commit 05ab5cc248a5708036ed27ae13a6f5d5e3bb8d1d)

Pin minitest

minitest 5.12.1[1] requires ruby ~>2.3.

[1] https://rubygems.org/gems/minitest/versions/5.12.1

Closes-Bug: #1845785
(cherry picked from commit 574c5bfd3bb645edd6b180e6d36b44e9beb10d77)

Change-Id: I4fca85f29fe1984707d500e1b87a0227cf4779dc

commit_message:
Deployment host can provide shibboleth SP key-pair

If you don't want to generate shibboleth SP key-pair on first playbook run
You can provide sp-cert.pem and sp-key.pem in /etc/openstack_deploy/keystone/

Change-Id: I6fb099cee10ef76f2cd6d20a03ffe53f45a1f85d
Signed-off-by: Kourosh Vivan <kourosh.vivan@osones.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_keystone refs/changes/24/620324/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Copy Shibboleth SP key-pair (if provided) copy: content: "{{ item.content }}" dest: "{{ item.dest }}" mode: "{{ item.mode|default('0640') }}" when: - inventory_hostname == groups['keystone_all'][0] - item.content != '' with_items: - { content: "{{ shibboleth_cert_user_content }}", dest: "/etc/shibboleth/sp-cert.pem" } - { content: "{{ shibboleth_key_user_content }}", dest: "/etc/shibboleth/sp-key.pem" } notify: - Manage LB - Restart web server - Restart Shibd

commit_message:
Fix CI

This combines the following two patches which need to be landed together
to fix the stable branches. Additionally disable beaker until we can
land this patch.

Pin rake

rake 13.0.0 requires ruby 2.1.0.

Closes-Bug: #1845649
(cherry picked from commit 05ab5cc248a5708036ed27ae13a6f5d5e3bb8d1d)

Pin minitest

minitest 5.12.1[1] requires ruby ~>2.3.

[1] https://rubygems.org/gems/minitest/versions/5.12.1

Closes-Bug: #1845785
(cherry picked from commit 574c5bfd3bb645edd6b180e6d36b44e9beb10d77)

Change-Id: I4fca85f29fe1984707d500e1b87a0227cf4779dc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack_spec_helper refs/changes/93/685493/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Modify nova routing table to process null requests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-06 22:45:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e4bfe032edc87cedaea738b470f03ee1d6c34c4c', 'message': 'Modify nova routing table to process null requests

The nova client RESTful API requests of '' (NULL), '/', and
'/versions/{id}' are routed to the "{'GET': [version_controller,
'show']}" method by the first three entries of the nova server routing
table. Entries two and three do it explicitly, but NULL requests cause
an HTML redirect that results in the nova client issuing a new request
intended to match entry two ('/'). This redirection can return an
invalid target URL, specifically when an SSL termination proxy is
employed, causing the nova client to raise an exception of "Unable to
establish connection to <invalid URL>: ('Connection aborted.',
BadStatusLine("''",))".

This commit makes the following changes:

1. Elimination of HTTP 302 redirection for a '' (NULL) version request.
The first entry of the nova server routing table is modified to handle
a '' (NULL) request explicitly by replacing it with a modified copy of
the second entry; the new first entry has a path of '' (NULL), whereas
the second entry has a path of '/'.

2. The nova server version controller uses a special case to map
'/' version requests to the "index" action. This change also maps ''
(NULL) requests to the "index" action.

3. The nova API request function returns an invalid "application_url"
of "http://<fqdn>/v2" when processing a '' (NULL) version list request,
but not for other requests. A new special case was added to the version
view to provide the correct "application_url" of  "http://<fqdn>"

4. The changes above caused the following two nova API unit tests to
fail because the expected behavior has changed:

  o VersionsTestV21.test_get_version_list_302
  o VersionsTestV21WithV2CompatibleWrapper.test_get_version_list_302

This commit replaces and renames the two failing unit tests with two
tests for the new behavior. The two replacement tests are named:

  o VersionsTestV21.test_get_version_list_noslash
  o VersionsTestV21WithV2CompatibleWrapper.test_get_version_list_noslash

In both cases, instead of an HTTP 302 redirect to '/' (get versions
list), these tests expect an identical response for a '' (NULL) and a
'/' request, ie. HTTP 200 with a body containing a list of versions.

Closes-Bug: 1728732

commit_message:
Modify nova routing table to process null requests

The nova client RESTful API requests of '' (NULL), '/', and
'/versions/{id}' are routed to the "{'GET': [version_controller,
'show']}" method by the first three entries of the nova server routing
table. Entries two and three do it explicitly, but NULL requests cause
an HTML redirect that results in the nova client issuing a new request
intended to match entry two ('/'). This redirection can return an
invalid target URL, specifically when an SSL termination proxy is
employed, causing the nova client to raise an exception of "Unable to
establish connection to <invalid URL>: ('Connection aborted.',
BadStatusLine("''",))".

This commit makes the following changes:

1. Elimination of HTTP 302 redirection for a '' (NULL) version request.
The first entry of the nova server routing table is modified to handle
a '' (NULL) request explicitly by replacing it with a modified copy of
the second entry; the new first entry has a path of '' (NULL), whereas
the second entry has a path of '/'.

2. The nova server version controller uses a special case to map
'/' version requests to the "index" action. This change also maps ''
(NULL) requests to the "index" action.

3. The nova API request function returns an invalid "application_url"
of "http://<fqdn>/v2" when processing a '' (NULL) version list request,
but not for other requests. A new special case was added to the version
view to provide the correct "application_url" of  "http://<fqdn>"

4. The changes above caused the following two nova API unit tests to
fail because the expected behavior has changed:

  o VersionsTestV21.test_get_version_list_302
  o VersionsTestV21WithV2CompatibleWrapper.test_get_version_list_302

This commit replaces and renames the two failing unit tests with two
tests for the new behavior. The two replacement tests are named:

  o VersionsTestV21.test_get_version_list_noslash
  o VersionsTestV21WithV2CompatibleWrapper.test_get_version_list_noslash

In both cases, instead of an HTTP 302 redirect to '/' (get versions
list), these tests expect an identical response for a '' (NULL) and a
'/' request, ie. HTTP 200 with a body containing a list of versions.

Change-Id: I24a5421c827312dec476d19b3d92584c6f1e27b3
Closes-Bug: 1728732

subject: Add a way to spy on function calls in test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-10-02 16:21:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/986bce9cf3ddb24e31c01facb8423e1389322643', 'message': 'WIP: Another swing at `spy`

This one makes the calling environment behave a lot more like a normal
mock.

WIP: a real commit message

Change-Id: Ib387822ae20e2e68489680ff4cfeab20d0cf57bf
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-10-02 22:54:22.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/spy.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_spy.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/f231c27db1952293754fab00e65bd66fbc9f6327', 'message': 'Add a way to spy on function calls in test

With the mock lib we can replace functions with mocks and execute
arbitrary callables instead of the mocked function. But there is no
easy way to call the original function while the test spies on the
call.

This patch adds a spy context manager that allows executing arbitrary
callables before and after a function from the system under test.

The context manager returns an object that can be used to track data
across calls, including from within the `before` and `after` callables.
The tracker also has a subset of the semantics of a mock, in that calls
are tracked (properties like call_count, methods like assert_has_calls,
etc.)

Co-Authored-By: Balazs Gibizer <balazs.gibizer@est.tech>

Change-Id: Ib387822ae20e2e68489680ff4cfeab20d0cf57bf
'}]
commit_message:
Add a way to spy on function calls in test

With the mock lib we can replace functions with mocks and execute
arbitrary callables instead of the mocked function. But there is no
easy way to call the original function while the test spies on the
call.

This patch adds a spy context manager that allows executing arbitrary
callables before and after a function from the system under test.

The context manager returns an object that can be used to track data
across calls, including from within the `before` and `after` callables.
The tracker also has a subset of the semantics of a mock, in that calls
are tracked (properties like call_count, methods like assert_has_calls,
etc.)

Co-Authored-By: Balazs Gibizer <balazs.gibizer@est.tech>

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock import testtools import nova from nova.tests import spy def target_func(param1, param2=None): return param1, param2 class TargetClass(object): def __init__(self): self.calls = [] def method(self, param1, param2=None): self.calls.append((param1, param2)) return len(self.calls) class TestSpy(testtools.TestCase): def test_spy_on_method(self): t = TargetClass() with spy.spy(TargetClass, 'method') as method_mock: method_mock.assert_not_called() self.assertEqual(1, t.method('foo', param2='bar')) method_mock.assert_called_once_with(t, 'foo', param2='bar') self.assertEqual(2, t.method('baz')) self.assertEqual(2, method_mock.call_count) method_mock.assert_has_calls([ mock.call(t, 'foo', param2='bar'), mock.call(t, 'baz') ]) def test_spy_on_function(self): with spy.spy(nova.tests.unit.test_spy, 'target_func') as func_mock: func_mock.assert_not_called() self.assertEqual(('foo', 'bar'), target_func('foo', param2='bar')) func_mock.assert_called_once_with('foo', param2='bar') self.assertEqual(('baz', None), target_func('baz')) self.assertEqual(2, func_mock.call_count) func_mock.assert_has_calls([ mock.call('foo', param2='bar'), mock.call('baz') ]) def test_before_and_after(self): """Validate before and after methods, using the _mock as an arbitrary data store.""" t = TargetClass() def before(_mock, *args, **kwargs): # Store an arbitrary property on _mock _mock.arbitrary_attribute = 'foo %d' % _mock.call_count # Raise on the first invocation, but do the normal thing thereafter if _mock.message == 'not called yet': _mock.message = 'been called now' raise ValueError('Raising on invocation %d' % _mock.call_count) def after(_mock, result, *args, **kwargs): # Value from the `before` invocation is preserved. Note that the # call_count was incremented between `before` and `after`. self.assertEqual( 'foo %d' % (_mock.call_count - 1), _mock.arbitrary_attribute) # Try this one with an instance instead of a class with spy.spy(t, 'method', before=before, after=after) as the_mock: # We can feed data from the_mock all the way through the chain the_mock.message = 'not called yet' # First invocation raises. exc = self.assertRaises(ValueError, t.method, 'foo', param2='bar') # self.assertRaises returns the exception as expected. self.assertEqual('Raising on invocation 0', exc.args[0]) # Second invocation behaves normally; the method thinks it's the # first invocation (because it is). self.assertEqual(1, t.method('foo2', param2='bar2')) self.assertEqual(2, t.method('foo3')) # The _mock kept track of the actual calls properly, but the one # where `before` raised was skipped # TODO(efried): Not sure if this is the most natural behavior for # the caller to expect. self.assertEqual(2, the_mock.call_count) the_mock.assert_has_calls([ mock.call('foo2', param2='bar2'), mock.call('foo3') ]) def test_spy_removed_after_exit(self): t = TargetClass() def spy_before_raises(_mock, *args, **kwargs): raise ValueError() def spy_after(_mock, result, *args, **kwargs): self.fail( 'The after callable should not be called if before is raised') with spy.spy( TargetClass, 'method', before=spy_before_raises, after=spy_after) as the_mock: # spy breaks the call self.assertRaises(ValueError, t.method, 'foo') # And the mock agrees the_mock.assert_not_called() # now the spy is removed so the call succeeds self.assertEqual(1, t.method('foo'))

commit_message:
Add capability of adding additional network API extensions

Currently, devstack has NETWORK_API_EXTENSIONS var to define
the network API extensions. NETWORK_API_EXTENSIONS is defaulted
to 'all' for master and hard coded list of extensions per release.
Zuul jobs of network extensions (for example neutron-fwaas) need
add the some extra extensions in the default list. To do so, they
need to duplicate all the defaults extensions and then add the extra
extensions. Much difficult situation is when defaults extensions list
vary from release to release so they have to keep updating the
NETWORK_API_EXTENSIONS per release.

This commit defines a new var ADDITIONAL_NETWORK_API_EXTENSIONS which
will take extra extensions and append into the default list. This way
Zuul jobs do not need to duplicate the default extensions.

Change-Id: I7270c9b9e047a851970439522c0356c9089a5b74
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/08/666508/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add capability of adding additional network API extensions

Currently, devstack has NETWORK_API_EXTENSIONS var to define
the network API extensions. NETWORK_API_EXTENSIONS is defaulted
to 'all' for master and hard coded list of extensions per release.
Zuul jobs of network extensions (for example neutron-fwaas) need
add the some extra extensions in the default list. To do so, they
need to duplicate all the defaults extensions and then add the extra
extensions. Much difficult situation is when defaults extensions list
vary from release to release so they have to keep updating the
NETWORK_API_EXTENSIONS per release.

This commit defines a new var ADDITIONAL_NETWORK_API_EXTENSIONS which
will take extra extensions and append into the default list. This way
Zuul jobs do not need to duplicate the default extensions.

Change-Id: I7270c9b9e047a851970439522c0356c9089a5b74
(cherry picked from commit 52c2886f7ede0e47f53b65fd1fd30f7d6ca7c086)

commit_message:
Remove plumgrid support

This change removes all plumgrid templates and options from the code base.
Sadly the company "plumgrid" no longer exists, and because of that, there's
no need to carry this deployment code.

Change-Id: I9767602f6930516b577baf9b2f0feb71e4bf4fdf
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use tempest_cloud_name in featureset_override

since tripleo now have os_cloud clouds.yaml support for
multinode, standalone and undercloude deployment. tempest and
tobiko now uses os_cloud name for deployment. In order to re-use
the same we can pass it through featureset_override instead of
hardcoding in playbook.

Change-Id: If1112c77664aa0a699bf9778c40a9f20a4651b2d
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix error log output information parameters.

Log files always output a log like this
"Clone pool_name/img_name to none/img_name_disk".
According to the log dest pool is none, but it's not actually.
It is easy to debug with this parameter.

Change-Id: I0b2e3ca91967f86946e231f813f69da7d0cbfe32
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/77/575277/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Make Ussuri the future series
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-10-04 16:19:56.000000000', 'files': ['data/series_status.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/commit/7983ef9e09842e46f4303489e613cf9a6e14b5c6', 'message': 'Make Ussuri the future series

If we make Ussuri the future release, the htaccess will be generated
with redirections for it. When we decide that Train is maintained and
not developed, we should move Ussuri to development. And add 'Vancouver'
or something when we know the next series name to immediately generate
the new redirection.

Alternatively, we could change the code to generate the redirections
at all times. If the code is idempotent, we would never have an
issue of "forgotten" state of a series, and could bypass it.

Change-Id: I69008ebd330a90ae42166d55e5c06b694fc2d042
'}]
commit_message:
Make Ussuri the future series

If we make Ussuri the future release, the htaccess will be generated
with redirections for it. When we decide that Train is maintained and
not developed, we should move Ussuri to development. And add 'Vancouver'
or something when we know the next series name to immediately generate
the new redirection.

Alternatively, we could change the code to generate the redirections
at all times. If the code is idempotent, we would never have an
issue of "forgotten" state of a series, and could bypass it.

Change-Id: I69008ebd330a90ae42166d55e5c06b694fc2d042

commit_message:
Check path alive before get scsi wwn

In FC environment, when disconnect volume,
if the first path in the loop is failed,
it will lead get scsi wwn to failure.
So I think we need to add path validity check
before get scsi wwn

Change-Id: I9d3a9dac13dcd585330e7b891c61b2626e5aabec
Closes-Bug: 1831621
(cherry picked from commit 3b8d5b7886b9a45df6b666ef594f4a337914856d)

commit_message:
PDF documentation build

- doc/source/readme.rst is introduced to render both HTML and PDF
  versions properly. The latex builder used to build PDF recognizes
  the document structure based on toctree directives, so a hidden
  toctree for readme is added to index.rst.
- doc/requiremens.txt is introduced to split the documentation
  dependencies following the community convention.
- Along with the previous, python modules only in doc/requirements.txt
  are dropped from lower-constraints.txt as we are not using
  lower-constraints for documentation build.

Change-Id: I8e58cca91506f72b868dec151e070e0f8a69ded4
Story: 2006099
Task: 35126

commit_message:
Restore console proxy deployment info to cells v2 layout doc

This information was mistakenly removed when references to the
nova-consoleauth service were removed from the docs in change
Ie96e18ea7762b93b4116b35d7ebcfcbe53c55527.

Closes-Bug: #1846401

Change-Id: I08fa4650d190114775993e8094efbf46b984dfdc

added_lines: Console proxies ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Starting from the Rocky release, console proxies must be run per cell because console token authorizations are stored in cell databases. This means that each console proxy server must have access to the :oslo.config:option:`database.connection` information for the cell database containing the instances for which it is proxying console access.

commit_message:
Fix evacuation when host dies uncleanly

This is a squashed backport of fix and relevant test

1.  Fix evacuation when host dies uncleanly

If a host crashes and ovn-controller doesn't clean up the
Port_Binding chassis column, the Logical_Switch_Port is never set
to DOWN, so we do not detect the up->down transition and update the
port status with the driver. This patch watches for Port_Binding
chassis column changes and if the port is up goes ahead and updates
the driver.

Conflicts:
        networking_ovn/ovsdb/ovsdb_monitor.py

(cherry picked from commit 4f73c0f016ddda50e25fe7592bb67435384e38f2)

2. Test PortBindingChassisUpdateEvent

While other tests cover what happens when a Port_Binding is updated
when this event doesn't match, there was no test that covered the
case when it does. This test does test primarily implementation
details, but will have to do until we can test the actual use case
which involves uncleanly killing a compute server and doing a
'host evacuate' from it.

Conflicts:
        networking_ovn/tests/unit/ovsdb/test_ovsdb_monitor.py

(cherry picked from commit f234deba187e8b56c574aa0d6a24cf69cbbd7cb1)

Closes-Bug: #1840876
(cherry picked from commit 36f06a32bbfc34d8e4e49d2a3f5fd385e4b4f863)
(cherry picked from commit 562f50798bfeb325de2f2b1d443bba05d6b8cb6d)

3. BaseEvent backport from dd53505c6418888ff74b383a7a824d04b20b6354
This is needed because the version of ovsdbapp in queens does not have
the match_fn() changes.
Change-Id: I8a5e6ad2e98b79a140977ce003609ed5b21e3499
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/41/678241/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class PortBindingChassisUpdateEvent(row_event.RowEvent): """Event for matching a port moving chassis If the LSP is up and the Port_Binding chassis has just changed, there is a good chance the host died without cleaning up the chassis column on the Port_Binding, so the port never goes down and we won't see update the driver with the LogicalSwitchPortUpdateUpEvent. """ def __init__(self, driver): self.driver = driver table = 'Port_Binding' events = (self.ROW_UPDATE,) super(PortBindingChassisUpdateEvent, self).__init__( events, table, None) self.event_name = self.__class__.__name__ def match_fn(self, event, row, old=None): # NOTE(twilson) ROW_UPDATE events always pass old if not row.chassis or row.chassis == old.chassis: return False if row.type == ovn_const.OVN_CHASSIS_REDIRECT: return False try: lsp = self.driver._nb_ovn.lookup('Logical_Switch_Port', row.logical_port) except idlutils.RowNotFound: LOG.warning("Logical Switch Port %(port)s not found for " "Port_Binding %(binding)s", {'port': row.logical_port, 'binding': row.uuid}) return False return bool(lsp.up) def run(self, event, row, old=None): self.driver.set_port_status_up(row.logical_port) self.notify_handler.watch_events( [self._chassis_event, self._portbinding_event, PortBindingChassisUpdateEvent(self.driver)])

commit_message:
Add profile_tasks to ansible runs

Adding profile_tasks to the default ansible.cfg so we get task timing in
the output.

https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/plugins/callback/profile_tasks.html

Change-Id: I6e5ff1f59e8179133099f3b9e405d66aab24be78

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I1dea02f79bf098d9bb8407100fca44726cb78594

commit_message:
Move nested bash script into a real file

container-puppet.py had within it a nested bash script using
a string literal. This change moves that script into a stand
alone file which will be copied to the host and used when
needed. This change will begin allowing us to deconstruct
the container-puppet.py process allowing us to simplify the
process, inturn making deployments more reliable, faster,
and easier to understand.

Change-Id: I447f33f159c5a50e55401b4e0a893c250869d185
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/70/683270/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. set -e [ "$DEBUG" = "false" ] || set -x mkdir -p /etc/puppet cp -dR /tmp/puppet-etc/* /etc/puppet rm -Rf /etc/puppet/ssl # not in use and causes permission errors echo "{\\"step\\": $STEP}" > /etc/puppet/hieradata/docker_puppet.json TAGS="" if [ -n "$PUPPET_TAGS" ]; then TAGS="--tags \"$PUPPET_TAGS\"" fi CHECK_MODE="" if [ -d "/tmp/puppet-check-mode" ]; then mkdir -p /etc/puppet/check-mode cp -a /tmp/puppet-check-mode/* /etc/puppet/check-mode CHECK_MODE="--hiera_config /etc/puppet/check-mode/hiera.yaml" fi # Create a reference timestamp to easily find all files touched by # puppet. The sync ensures we get all the files we want due to # different timestamp. origin_of_time=/var/lib/config-data/${NAME}.origin_of_time touch $origin_of_time sync export NET_HOST="${NET_HOST:-false}" set +e if [ "$NET_HOST" == "false" ]; then export FACTER_hostname=$HOSTNAME fi # $::deployment_type in puppet-tripleo export FACTER_deployment_type=containers export FACTER_uuid=$(cat /sys/class/dmi/id/product_uuid | tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]') echo 'Running puppet' # FIXME(bogdando): stdout may be falling behind of the logged syslog messages set -x /usr/bin/puppet apply --summarize \ --detailed-exitcodes \ --color=false \ --modulepath=/etc/puppet/modules:/usr/share/openstack-puppet/modules \ $TAGS \ $CHECK_MODE \ /etc/config.pp \ 2>&1 | logger -s -t puppet-user rc=${PIPESTATUS[0]} [ "$DEBUG" = "false" ] && set +x set -e if [ $rc -ne 2 -a $rc -ne 0 ]; then exit $rc fi verbosity="" [ "$DEBUG" = "false" ] || verbosity="-v" # Disables archiving if [ -z "$NO_ARCHIVE" ]; then archivedirs=("/etc" "/root" "/opt" "/var/lib/ironic/tftpboot" "/var/lib/ironic/httpboot" "/var/www" "/var/spool/cron" "/var/lib/nova/.ssh") rsync_srcs="" for d in "${archivedirs[@]}"; do if [ -d "$d" ]; then rsync_srcs+=" $d" fi done # On stack update, if a password was changed in a config file, # some services (e.g. mysql) must change their internal state # (e.g. password in mysql DB) when paunch restarts them; and # they need the old password to achieve that. # For those services, we update the config hash to notify # paunch that a restart is needed, but we do not update the # password file in container-puppet if the file already existed # before and let the service regenerate it instead. password_files="/root/.my.cnf" exclude_files="" for p in $password_files; do if [ -f "$p" -a -f "/var/lib/config-data/${NAME}$p" ]; then exclude_files+=" --exclude=$p" fi done # Exclude read-only mounted directories/files which we do not want # to copy or delete. ro_files="/etc/puppetlabs/ /opt/puppetlabs/" for ro in $ro_files; do if [ -e "$ro" ]; then exclude_files+=" --exclude=$ro" fi done echo "Rsyncing config files from ${rsync_srcs} into /var/lib/config-data/${NAME}" rsync -a $verbosity -R --delay-updates --delete-after $exclude_files $rsync_srcs /var/lib/config-data/${NAME} # Also make a copy of files modified during puppet run # This is useful for debugging echo "Gathering files modified after $(stat -c '%y' $origin_of_time)" mkdir -p /var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/${NAME} exec 5>&1 exec 1>/tmp/files_from find $rsync_srcs -newer $origin_of_time -not -path '/etc/puppet*' -print0 exec 1>&5 echo "Files modified during puppet run:" cat /tmp/files_from | sort | xargs -0 printf "%s\n" echo "Rsyncing the modified files into /var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/${NAME}" rsync -a $verbosity -R -0 --delay-updates \ --delete-after $exclude_files \ --files-from=/tmp/files_from / /var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/${NAME} # Write a checksum of the config-data dir, this is used as a # salt to trigger container restart when the config changes # note: while being excluded from the output, password files # are still included in checksum computation additional_checksum_files="" excluded_original_passwords="" for p in $password_files; do if [ -f "$p" ]; then additional_checksum_files+=" $p" excluded_original_passwords+=" --exclude=/var/lib/config-data/*${p}" fi done # We need to exclude the swift ring backups as those change over time and # containers do not need to restart if they change EXCLUDE=--exclude='*/etc/swift/backups/*'\ --exclude='*/etc/libvirt/passwd.db'\ ${excluded_original_passwords} # We need to repipe the tar command through 'tar xO' to force text # output because otherwise the sed command cannot work. The sed is # needed because puppet puts timestamps as comments in cron and # parsedfile resources, hence triggering a change at every redeploy tar -c --mtime='1970-01-01' $EXCLUDE -f - /var/lib/config-data/${NAME} $additional_checksum_files | tar xO | \ sed '/^#.*HEADER.*/d' | md5sum | awk '{print $1}' > /var/lib/config-data/${NAME}.md5sum tar -c --mtime='1970-01-01' $EXCLUDE -f - /var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/${NAME} $additional_checksum_files --mtime='1970-01-01' | tar xO \ | sed '/^#.*HEADER.*/d' | md5sum | awk '{print $1}' > /var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/${NAME}.md5sum fi

commit_message:
Configuration changes to support Qdr-mesh topology.

These changes update router mode to edge or interior
depending on the node type. The mesh topology is
formed on controller nodes and remaining nodes will
connect to this topology.

Co-Authored-By: Martin Magr <mmagr@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I195dbf70f490984cedb32d48fe09f4562cbf94fa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/08/647908/29 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*connector_addr*] # (optional) Connector Ip address # Defaults to undef ## [*oslomsg_rpc_hosts*] # list of oslo messaging rpc host fqdns # Defaults to hiera('oslo_messaging_rpc_nodes_names', undef) # $connector_addr = undef, $oslomsg_rpc_hosts = hiera('oslo_messaging_rpc_node_names', undef), $qdr_controller_nodes = $oslomsg_rpc_hosts if $step >= 1 { if $connector_addr { $qdr_connectors = [{'host' => $connector_addr, 'port' => '10666', 'role' => 'inter-router', 'authenticatePeer' => 'no'}] $qdr_router_mode = 'edge' } else { $internal_connectors = $qdr_controller_nodes.reduce([]) |$memo, $node| { if $::hostname in $node { $memo + true } else { if true in $memo { $memo } else { $memo + [{'host' => $node, 'role' => 'inter-router', 'port' => '10666'}] } } } - true $qdr_router_mode = 'interior' $qdr_connectors = concat($connectors, $internal_connectors) } $extra_listeners = [{'host' => '0.0.0.0', 'port' => '10666', 'role' => 'inter-router'}] router_mode => $qdr_router_mode, connectors => $qdr_connectors, extra_listeners => $extra_listeners,

commit_message:
Replace mock with spy in test

There are places in the functional test where we mock functions but at
the same time we want to call the original function when the mock is
called. The mock lib does not give out of the box tools for this
behavior but Ib387822ae20e2e68489680ff4cfeab20d0cf57bf implemented a
helper for it.

This patch replaces the first set of such mocking with spying in the
functional test.

Change-Id: I339df42a2e312a357cb23eeddff7f368b9632903
Co-Authored-By: Balazs Gibizer <balazs.gibizer@est.tech>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/08/686208/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.tests import spy tracker = mock.Mock(calls_on_hosts=[]) # Make the first prep_resize fail and the rest passing through # the original _prep_resize calls while collecting the host names # prep_resize is called on def spy_prep_resize(data, _self, *args, **kwargs): data.calls_on_hosts.append(_self.host) if len(data.calls_on_hosts) == 1: with spy.spy( data=tracker, before=spy_prep_resize): # ensure that resize is tried on two hosts, so we had a re-schedule self.assertEqual(['host2', 'host3'], tracker.calls_on_hosts)
deleted_lines: # Yes this isn't great in a functional test, but it's simple. original_prep_resize = compute_manager.ComputeManager._prep_resize prep_resize_calls = [] def fake_prep_resize(_self, *args, **kwargs): # Make the first prep_resize fail and the rest passing through # the original _prep_resize call if not prep_resize_calls: prep_resize_calls.append(_self.host) prep_resize_calls.append(_self.host) original_prep_resize(_self, *args, **kwargs) with mock.patch.object( new=fake_prep_resize): # ensure that resize is tried on two hosts, so we had a re-schedule self.assertEqual(['host2', 'host3'], prep_resize_calls)

commit_message:
Added support for train for emit release file

It is needed train related upgrade jobs and fixes
the tests for the same.

It also rename the old-current-tripleo to previous-current-tripleo
in test name.

https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/1299

commit_message:
Add the "connection_logging" parameter

The connection_logging parameter allows you to disable connection
flow logging.

Change-Id: Iaac3675a9c34e0c30ea925a7fc74edcfdf1d10df

commit_message:
WIP: VMware: implement update_provider_tree()

Create a child resource provider for each resource pool under the
corresponding compute cluster in vCenter. Create a custom trait for each
resource pool, so we can make the scheduler place allocations there.

Change-Id: Ia417a487da39469eab2625c76167e8aab60fbe83

commit_message:
Pass user context detaching volume on exceptions

I751fcb7532679905c4279744919c6cce84a11eb4 changed the interface for
virt drivers' detach_volume method to include passing in the user
context. This change updates a couple usages that were missed within
exceptions during volume attaches.

Change-Id: Ie5ec39a311567b8e21d2695a386fb4da0c6987ed
